_meta.description: Healthcare Claims Index - Comprehensive EDI 835 Processing and Analysis
_meta.purpose: This index serves as the central repository for healthcare claims data processed from EDI 835 (Health Care Claim Payment/Advice) files. It enables comprehensive analysis of claim processing, payment patterns, provider performance, and financial reconciliation across healthcare organizations. The index supports semantic search capabilities for claims investigation, fraud detection, provider network analysis, and financial reporting. It facilitates real-time querying of claim status, payment history, adjustment patterns, and service utilization trends. This data structure enables healthcare administrators to track claim lifecycle from submission through payment, identify processing bottlenecks, analyze provider billing patterns, and generate comprehensive financial reports for stakeholders.

claim_id.description: Unique identifier for the healthcare claim. Used for claim tracking, reference, and linking across systems. Format typically includes alphanumeric characters and may include prefixes indicating claim type or source system.
claim_id.purpose: Primary key for claim identification and cross-system referencing

policy_id.description: Insurance policy identifier associated with the patient's coverage. Links the claim to the specific insurance policy under which services were provided.
policy_id.purpose: Links claims to insurance policies for coverage verification and billing

patient_id.description: Unique patient identifier within the healthcare system. Used for patient record linking and care coordination across multiple claims and providers.
patient_id.purpose: Enables patient-centric analysis and care coordination

provider_id.description: Internal provider identifier used by the healthcare organization. May differ from NPI and is used for internal tracking and reporting.
provider_id.purpose: Internal provider tracking and performance analysis

payer_id.description: Insurance company or payer identifier. Identifies the entity responsible for processing and paying the claim.
payer_id.purpose: Identifies the responsible payer for claim processing and payment

claim_date.description: Date when the claim was originally submitted to the payer. Critical for tracking claim processing timelines and identifying delays.
claim_date.purpose: Tracks claim submission timeline and processing efficiency

service_start_date.description: Date when the healthcare service was first provided to the patient. Used for service period validation and coverage determination.
service_start_date.purpose: Defines the service period for coverage and billing validation

service_end_date.description: Date when the healthcare service was completed. For single-day services, this may be the same as service_start_date.
service_end_date.purpose: Defines the end of service period for billing and coverage

remittance_date.description: Date when the EDI 835 remittance advice was generated by the payer. Indicates when payment processing was completed.
remittance_date.purpose: Tracks payment processing timeline and EDI 835 generation

claim_status.description: Current status of the claim in the processing workflow. Indicates whether the claim has been paid, denied, pending, or requires additional information.
claim_status.purpose: Provides real-time claim status for workflow management and reporting

claim_type.description: Classification of the claim based on the type of service provided. Helps categorize claims for reporting and analysis purposes.
claim_type.purpose: Enables service-type analysis and specialized reporting

total_charge_amount.description: Total amount billed by the provider for all services included in the claim. Represents the provider's full charges before any adjustments or payments.
total_charge_amount.purpose: Tracks provider billing amounts for financial analysis and reconciliation

total_paid_amount.description: Total amount paid by the insurance company for the claim. Represents the actual payment made to the provider.
total_paid_amount.purpose: Tracks actual payments for financial reconciliation and cash flow analysis

total_adjustment_amount.description: Total amount of adjustments made to the claim. Includes contractual adjustments, denials, and other modifications to the original billed amount.
total_adjustment_amount.purpose: Analyzes adjustment patterns and provider contract performance

patient_responsibility.description: Total amount the patient is responsible for paying, including copayments, deductibles, and coinsurance.
patient_responsibility.purpose: Tracks patient financial responsibility for billing and collection

patient.description: Patient demographic and insurance information associated with the claim. Contains personal details and coverage information for patient identification and eligibility verification.

first_name.description: Patient's first name as recorded in the insurance system. Used for patient identification and record matching.

last_name.description: Patient's last name or surname. Critical for patient identification and family grouping analysis.
last_name.purpose: Patient identification and family demographic analysis

middle_name.description: Patient's middle name or middle initial. Used for complete patient identification and record disambiguation.
middle_name.purpose: Enhanced patient identification and record matching

date_of_birth.description: Patient's date of birth. Used for age calculation, eligibility verification, and demographic analysis.

gender.description: Patient's gender designation. Used for demographic analysis and certain medical service eligibility.
gender.purpose: Demographic analysis and service eligibility determination

member_id.description: Unique member identifier assigned by the insurance company. Primary identifier for patient within the payer's system.
member_id.purpose: Primary patient identification within insurance system

group_number.description: Group number associated with the patient's insurance plan. Identifies the employer or organization providing coverage.
group_number.purpose: Identifies coverage group for plan-specific analysis

address.description: Patient's residential address information. Used for geographic analysis and service area determination.

street.description: Street address including house number and street name.
street.purpose: Geographic analysis and service area mapping

possible_values: Examples: New York, Los Angeles, Chicago

state.description: State or province where the patient resides.

zip_code.description: Postal or ZIP code for the patient's address.
zip_code.purpose: Detailed geographic analysis and service area mapping

provider.description: Healthcare provider information associated with the claim. Contains provider identification, contact details, and billing information for provider analysis and network management.

npi.description: National Provider Identifier - unique 10-digit identifier for healthcare providers in the United States. Standard identifier used across all healthcare systems.
npi.purpose: Standard provider identification across healthcare systems

name.description: Provider's business name or practice name. May be individual provider name or organization name.
possible_values: Examples: Dr. John Smith, ABC Medical Group

tax_id.description: Provider's Tax Identification Number (TIN) or Employer Identification Number (EIN). Used for tax reporting and billing purposes.

address.description: Provider's business address information. Used for geographic analysis and service area determination.

street.description: Provider's street address including building number and street name.
possible_values: Examples: 123 Medical Plaza, 456 Health Center Dr
street.purpose: Geographic analysis and service area mapping

city.description: City where the provider is located.

state.description: State where the provider is located.

zip_code.description: ZIP code for the provider's location.
zip_code.purpose: Detailed geographic analysis and service area mapping

payer.description: Insurance payer information responsible for processing and paying the claim. Contains payer identification and type for payer-specific analysis and reporting.

name.description: Name of the insurance company or payer organization.
possible_values: Examples: Blue Cross Blue Shield, Aetna, UnitedHealthcare

payer_id.description: Unique identifier for the payer organization. May be internal system ID or external payer code.

payer_type.description: Classification of the payer type based on coverage category.
payer_type.purpose: Payer type analysis and specialized reporting

service_lines.description: Detailed service line information for each procedure or service included in the claim. Contains procedure codes, diagnosis codes, dates, units, and financial details for granular analysis of services provided.

service_line_id.description: Unique identifier for each service line within the claim. Used for tracking individual services and linking to adjustments.
service_line_id.purpose: Individual service tracking and adjustment linking

procedure_code.description: CPT (Current Procedural Terminology) or HCPCS code identifying the specific medical procedure or service performed.

procedure_description.description: Human-readable description of the procedure or service performed. Provides context for the procedure code.
possible_values: Examples: Office visit, Blood draw, Injection

modifier_codes.description: Additional codes that modify or provide more specific information about the procedure performed.
modifier_codes.purpose: Enhanced procedure specification and billing accuracy

diagnosis_codes.description: ICD-10 diagnosis codes indicating the medical conditions or reasons for the service.
diagnosis_codes.purpose: Diagnosis tracking and medical necessity analysis

service_date.description: Date when the specific service was performed. May differ from claim dates for multi-day services.
service_date.purpose: Service date tracking and timeline analysis

units.description: Number of units or quantity of the service provided. Used for calculating total charges and utilization analysis.
units.purpose: Service quantity tracking and utilization analysis

billed_amount.description: Amount billed by the provider for this specific service line before any adjustments.

allowed_amount.description: Maximum amount the payer will allow for this service based on contract terms and fee schedules.
allowed_amount.purpose: Contract performance and fee schedule analysis

paid_amount.description: Actual amount paid by the payer for this specific service line.

adjustment_amount.description: Total amount of adjustments applied to this service line, including contractual adjustments and denials.

patient_responsibility.description: Amount the patient is responsible for paying for this specific service, including copays and deductibles.

adjustments.description: Detailed adjustment information explaining any modifications made to the claim amounts. Includes adjustment codes, reasons, amounts, and types for comprehensive adjustment analysis and reporting.

adjustment_code.description: Standardized code indicating the reason for the adjustment. Uses industry-standard adjustment reason codes.

adjustment_reason.description: Human-readable explanation of why the adjustment was made. Provides detailed context for the adjustment code.
possible_values: Examples: Contractual adjustment, Patient responsibility, Deductible

adjustment_amount.description: Dollar amount of the adjustment. Positive values indicate reductions, negative values indicate additions.
adjustment_amount.purpose: Adjustment amount tracking and financial analysis

adjustment_type.description: Category classification of the adjustment type for grouping and analysis purposes.

payment_info.description: Payment processing information including method, reference numbers, and dates. Used for payment tracking, reconciliation, and financial reporting.

payment_method.description: Method used to process the payment to the provider.
payment_method.purpose: Payment method analysis and processing optimization

check_number.description: Check number if payment was made by paper check. Used for check reconciliation and tracking.

eft_trace_number.description: Electronic Funds Transfer trace number for electronic payments. Used for EFT tracking and reconciliation.

payment_date.description: Date when the payment was actually processed and sent to the provider.
payment_date.purpose: Payment timeline tracking and cash flow analysis

edi_835_info.description: EDI 835 specific metadata and tracking information. Contains transaction identifiers, trace numbers, and processing dates for EDI file tracking and audit purposes.

transaction_id.description: Unique identifier for the EDI 835 transaction. Used for transaction tracking and audit trails.
transaction_id.purpose: EDI transaction tracking and audit trails

reassociation_trace_number.description: Trace number used to link the EDI 835 remittance advice to the original claim submission. Critical for claim-to-payment reconciliation.

production_date.description: Date when the EDI 835 file was produced by the payer system.

file_creation_date.description: Date when the EDI 835 file was created and ready for transmission.
file_creation_date.purpose: EDI file creation tracking and processing timeline
